p: Coronaviruses contain four major structural proteins, which include spike (S), membrane (M), envelope (E), and nucleocapsid (N) proteins, and these proteins all encoded at 3â€² end ORF in the genome. Functionally, S glycoproteins are involved as the main antigens in receptor binding and cell fusion [ 9], while M proteins are primarily involved in germination and envelope formation, and play a significant role in subsequent viral particle assembly [ 12]. The spike protein is essential for viral-cell receptor binding and this implies that the M protein is essential for receptor binding [ 13, 14]. Coronaviruses can cause respiratory and intestinal infections in animals and humans [ 15].
